meanings.definition: Showing a lack of courage or determination.
meanings.sent1: The kitten was the pussiest of all, hiding from the smallest noise.
meanings.sent2: He was known as the pussiest player on the team, always avoiding tough challenges.
meanings.sent3: The pussiest squirrel ran away from a falling acorn, thinking it was a giant boulder.
meanings.sent4: Her pussiest behavior made her miss out on exciting adventures.
meanings.sent5: The pussiest puppy trembled at the sight of a harmless butterfly.

meanings.sent1: Among the group of friends, he was the pussiest when it came to trying new foods.
meanings.sent2: The smallest dog in the litter was the pussiest, always shying away from playful interactions.
meanings.sent3: The pussiest bird refused to fly, fearing the heights of the treetops.
meanings.sent4: His pussiest attempt at lifting the heavy box ended in a comical stumble.
meanings.sent5: The pussiest flower in the garden wilted at the first sign of a breeze.

meanings.sent1: She was the pussiest of her siblings, jumping at the slightest sound in the dark.
meanings.sent2: The pussiest cat in the neighborhood would run away from its own shadow.
meanings.sent3: The pussiest mouse squeaked loudly at the sight of cheese, mistaking it for a trap.
meanings.sent4: The pussiest student in the class panicked during pop quizzes.
meanings.sent5: The pussiest ghost in the haunted house was scared of its own chains rattling.
